channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024040296
item.description:
Report E-2024040296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately six (6) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to a load shift that damaged the pails, impacting the concrete terminal floor and trailer floor. The terminal personnel cleaned the spilled material and containerized the recovered material into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040303
item.description:
Report X-2024040303

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was left on the van. QA was notified by management when the package handler noticed it was wet and still on the truck. When we realized it was a hazmat I put on gloves and then moved the box into a tote. upon inspection i found that one of the caps was loose causing the leak. DescribePack: upon inspection i found the cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put on gloves and tightened the lid.

item.title: Report X-2024040280
item.description:
Report X-2024040280

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Around 0900 contractor brought hazmat package to the attention of QA. Informed QA that the package appeared to be leaking a white granule substance from the bottom corners. DescribePack: While wearing gloves QA opened the hazmat package in a well ventilated area and removed inner drum from outer box. The inner plastic drum is cracked along the bottom side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaking hazmat box was then confiscated by QA for processing.

item.title: Report E-2024040299
item.description:
Report E-2024040299

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: NEW CARLISLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 25, 2024, eight (8) 50-pound bags of potassium nitrate were damaged by unsecured freight and released approximately one-hundred pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel overpacked the damaged bags in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then utilized hand tools and a vacuum unit to further remediate the site. All potassium nitrate-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. Both waste drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040308
item.description:
Report E-2024040308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9200
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a cap on the unloading line came loose and allowed approximately 50 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024040149
item.description:
Report X-2024040149

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment discovered after sort operations. Concealed DG (LTD QTY). 7 inner boxes marked/labeled with the surface Limited Quantity marking. Inner contents: Each of the 7 boxes contained 10 boxes with 2 plastic bags @ 100 ml each of Descaler. There was no spill or leak. The outer packaging was wet and damaged due to rain water. Note: Each of the 7 boxes contained a total of 2000 ml. Total outer box contained 14,000 ml

item.title: Report E-2024040124
item.description:
Report E-2024040124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, an unknown amount of Dairyland Brand Milkstone Remover and Acid Rinse (Hazardous - UN1760) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS spoke with the service center manager (Tim Dwitt) who requested SDS instructions on cleaning the release. The terminal did not want a contractor out for cleanup and containment. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, (4) 1 gallon poly jugs, and oil-dri will be placed into a 30 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024040111
item.description:
Report E-2024040111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-pound of Copper Metal Powder was released from (1) 3000 lb. super sack due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The remaining material in the damaged super sack was transferred to a new super sack. The released material was collected and placed into (1) 5-gallon poly drum.
